Title:
Arthrinium euphorbiae and Arthrinium guangdongense sp. nov.,
associated with Bamboo from Guangdong Province, China
Keywords:
1 new species, 1 new host record, Apiosporaceae,
phylogenetic analyses, taxonomy, saprobic
Abstract:
Arthrinium species are often found to be associated with
various bamboo species in Asia. They are endophytes, saprobes and
important plant pathogens on a wide range of hosts. In the present
study, saprobic Arthrinium species were isolated from bamboo plants
collected from Guangdong Province, China. Morphological comparison and
phylogenetic analyses using four gene regions, internal transcribed
spacer (ITS), large subunit rDNA (LSU), translation elongation factor
1-alpha (tef1-Î±), and beta-tubulin (tub2) were subsequently performed
for species identification. Based on both morphology and phylogeny, a
novel species, Arthrinium guangdongense and one new host record,
Arthrinium euphorbiae on bamboo were identified. Species descriptions
and morphological comparisons for these isolated taxa are given. The
results will be an additional contribution to the knowledge of fungi
associated with bamboo.
